column4: I have a dual boot system that is currently workng... it is time to reinstall XP... I had trouble not being able to restore/repair grub last time and had to reinstall Ubuntu.  SInce I have a working grub/boot atm is there a way to sagve it?
Dosent work
Yep
we tried all the different ways
I remember there was a way to dd a copy of the mbr...
probably dd if=source of=dest bs=440 count=1
try bs=446 instead*
That looks like it.. any documentation with that..
well here is the MBR layout: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_boot_record
code area is first 446 bytes of the disk.
so input would for example be /dev/sda, and output maybe /dev/sdb.  but not /sda1 sdb2 etc.. just sda sdb
but that is right other than needing sudo?
sudo fdisk -l > ~/myoutput
perfect thanks...
Careful hacking the ipods, I would hate to see you brick it
well last thing i tried i ended up Resetting via iTunes on the authorized windows machine and it was ifne
Just wanted to give a word of caution on doing that.
ya i might just hook it up to my VM thru usb
It just wants you to edit your xorg..
AN earlier version of K3b had a built in option to enter password for sudo in order to make the changes needed to setup the user with burning rights..
Things like that can be added program by program, but really isnt needed.
